translated: Elder’s Birth Stories
The Chapter with Bhaddiya

analyzed: kāḷ u dāyi ttheḥ a padāna
translated: The Elder Kāḷudāyī’s Birth Story
“The Victor named Padumuttara,

analyzed: sabba dhammesu cakkhumā  i taḥ sata sahassamhi
translated: the one with eyes to all things,🔽appeared as a leader

analyzed: kappe uppajji nāyakaḥ  nāyakānam varaḥ satthā
translated: a hundred thousand eons ago.🔽The teacher, the best of leaders,
the Victor who knows good and bad,
grateful and thankful,
he who gives to those who give.
With the knowledge of omniscience,🔽weighing up with the balance of compassion,
he teaches the supreme Dhamma,
a heap of infinite qualities.
Sometimes that great hero,
the Victor with infinite compassion,
teaches the sweet Dhamma,
connected with the four truths.

analyzed: sutvāna tam dhamma vara  ādi majjhanta sobhana
translated: Having heard that supreme Dhamma,🔽beautiful in the beginning, middle, and end,
a hundred thousand beings
attained the Dhamma.
Then the earth resounded,
and the clouds thundered,🔽and there was an exclamation of “Excellent!”
from gods, Brahmas, and demons.
“Ah! The compassionate teacher!

analyzed: aho saddhamma desanā  aho bhava samuddamhi
translated: Ah! The teaching of the true Dhamma!🔽Ah! The Victor has pulled out
those who are submerged in the ocean of existence!”
Thus did the gods,
the humans, and the Brahmas,
The foremost of those who inspire confidence in families,
The Victor described him as a disciple.🔽At that time I was born in the city of Haṁsavati,
In the family of the Acchā,
I was pleasing to look at,
And had abundant wealth and grain.

original: Haṁsārāmamupeccāhaṁ,🔽vanditvā taṁ tathāgataṁ;🔽Suṇitvā madhuraṁ dhammaṁ,🔽kāraṁ katvā ca tādino.
analyzed: hasa ārāmam upa id ca āha  vanditvā tam tathāgata  suṇitvā madhuram dhamma  kāram katvā ca tādinaḥ
translated: I approached the Haṁsa Park,🔽And after worshipping that Realised One,🔽After hearing the sweet Dhamma,
And making an offering to the One of Suchness,
I respectfully placed my feet at his feet,🔽And spoke this speech:
‘The foremost of those who inspire confidence in families,
Who is approved by you, Sage.
May I be like that, Hero,
In the Dispensation of the Buddha, the Best’;
Then the One of Great Compassion,
Sprinkling me with his left hand,
Said to me: ‘Son, arise,
You will attain your wish;
How could one who has made an offering to the Victor,
Be unsuccessful?
After a hundred thousand eons,
Born in the family of the Okkāka,
In the clan named Gotama,
A Teacher will appear in the world.

analyzed: tassa dhammesu dāyādaḥ  orasaḥ dhamma nimmito
translated: He will be an heir to his Dhamma,🔽A spiritual son of the One of Suchness,
Named Udāyī,
A disciple of the Teacher.’
After hearing that I was delighted,
For as long as I lived,
I served the Victor,
With requisites, the Leader.
By the result of that deed,
By intention and aspiration,
Having given up the human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
And in my last existence now,
in the delightful city of Kapilavatthu,
I was born in a great minister’s family,
to the King of the Earth Suddhodana.
Then Siddhattha was born,
in the delightful Lumbini Grove,
For the benefit of all the world,
for the happiness of the people.
On that very day I was born,
and I grew up with him,
A dear friend, beloved,
a wise man, skilled in policy.
At the age of twenty-nine,
after going forth from the home life,
After spending six years,
the Buddha, the Leader,
After defeating Māra and his army,
and after casting out the pollutants,
After crossing the ocean of existence,
the Buddha was (realised) in the world with the gods.
After going to the Deer Park,
and after training the group of five,

original: Tato vinesi bhagavā,🔽gantvā gantvā tahiṁ tahiṁ.
analyzed: tatas vinesi bhagavā  gantvā gantvā tahim tahi
translated: Then the Fortunate One trained,🔽going here and there,
Training those who should be trained,
I was the one who brought together🔽The one with the ten powers and the one with the ten powers’ mother.
The Victor then went to the Magadhan mountain,
And stayed there.

analyzed: tadā suddhodanena āha  bhūmipālena pesitaḥ  gantvā disvā dasabala
translated: Then I was sent by King Suddhodana🔽To go and see the one with the ten powers.
Having gone and seen him, I was worthy of the going forth.
Then I asked the Great Seer,🔽And brought him to Kapilavatthu.
Then I went and
Convinced the great clan.

original: Jino tasmiṁ guṇe tuṭṭho,🔽maṁ mahāparisāya so;
analyzed: jinaḥ tasmin guṇe tuṭṭhaḥ  mam mahāparisāya saḥ
translated: The Victor, pleased with my virtue,🔽In a great assembly
The Leader proclaimed me
Foremost of those who convince clans.
My defilements are destroyed,
I live without defilements.
Welcome indeed is it for me,
The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.
The four analytical knowledges,

original: kataṁ buddhassa sāsanaṁ”.🔽Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā kāḷudāyī thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.
analyzed: katam buddhassa sāsana  ittham sudam āyasmā kāḷudāyī theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati
translated: The Buddha’s instruction has been carried out.”🔽Thus spoke the venerable elder Kāḷudāyī,🔽and this is the tradition concerning the elder Kāḷudāyī.
The sixth section for recitation on the elders is finished.
